title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Hi,

I have an A1278 820-2533-B that had liquid contact and has no wifi. It has a burnt L3404, L3401, and some surroundig caps. I don't have any 820-2533-B to steal those parts. Can I use those parts from any other board?

TKS

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Actualy, it seams that only L3404 had exploded. However, the pads are gone.

Is there any way to fix this pads? If so, can i use other part from other board?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Bypass L3404 with a tiny wire.
Be sure no short on its pad 2 to ground; w/ and w/o airport connected.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
I don't think i  have a short in PP5V_WLAN. (OL in diode reading).

Just to be sure, i should jumper L3404 pin 1 to C3422 pin 1, correct?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: You should run a wire from PP5V_WLAN_F to PP5V_WLAN.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Tks. That's what I've done, I have 5V on  PP5V_WLAN , but still no wifi. It says no hardware present.
I'm not sure if i had to have continuity from L3401 (pin1) PCIE_CLK100M_MINI_CONN_N to C3422 PP5V_WLAN, but i don't have it.
Can it be U3402 (I have 3.3V on PP3V3_S3)? How can i check it?
What should I check now. Can you help?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: Post MINI_RESET_CONN_L, PCIE_MINI_PRSNT_L and MINI_CLKEWQ_L levels.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Just realized that the wire that i've jumped has "exploded" / breaked after a few reboots.
It seams that i have a short on the airport. With the  airport cable connected, i get 0.002 in diode readings, and 0.5 ohm to ground on  PP5V_WLAN . Can i check anything else?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Airport card, or cable.
Disconnect airport card on the other side of the cable.
See where the short remains.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
I'm sorry. I've write the wrong model. It is an 1286 820-2533-B model. 
The cable goes right to the interior of the display. Is there a card inside?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: Yes, under the black round plastic cover...

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Tks. Didn't know that.
The cable was presured by a screw. After disassembling it, the short has gone.
Now I have 5V on PP5V_WLAN and 0.504 in diode mode, and 50kohm to ground, but no wifi yet.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: Damaged cable, I suppose...

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
MINI_RESET_CONN_L = 3.3V

PCIE_MINI_PRSNT_L  = 0.001

MINI_CLKEWQ_L i can't find...

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: Sorry for the typo; read MINI_CLKREQ_L instead.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: MINI_CLKREQ_L  = 3,397V w/o airport conected. With airport conected, i get 0.024V

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Values look good.
Try connecting the airport from another LCD assembly.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Hi,
Today, i managed to find a display (with the wifi) for this model, and when i was trying it, the mac doesn't power on.
I have a missing PP5V_S3 and PP3V3_S5 voltage. I look at L3405 (the jumper was near to it)  and it seams ok, and can't find any missing components..
Can you help?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message: Does it turn on without LCD (no airport)?

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Hi, no it doesn't. However, I saw that c2511, c2581 and c2580 were knocked out.

Because i have no other 820-2533-B board, I've replaced them for 2x 16V X7R 100nF +- 10% caps (C2511 and C2581) and one 10V XR5 470nF +-10% (C2580) cap. Not sure if they are compatible. Are they?

Stil dosen't power on.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Do you get correct L7770 voltage?
Remember, this board doesn't start until press the power button.

title: A1278 820-2533-B no wifi
message:
Sorry. You're right (as always...).
It was the power button.
TKS!
